alert.note: Alert for St. Charles; St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 19 at 5:19PM CDT until May 19 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Madison County in southwestern Illinois... Southeastern Jersey County in southwestern Illinois... Northeastern St. Charles County in east central Missouri... North central St. Louis County in east central Missouri... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 518 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Bridgeton, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Orchard Farms around 525 PM CDT. West Alton and Portage Des Sioux around 530 PM CDT. Grafton and Elsah around 535 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 228 and 231. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
